trans-unit.source: Enumerates the first stream with a ::$DATA stream type in the specified file or directory

seg-source.mrk: Enumerates the first stream with a ::$DATA stream type in the specified file or directory

target.mrk: Enumerates the first stream with a ::$DATA stream type in the specified file or directory

trans-unit.source: A $tagWIN32_FIND_STREAM_DATA structure or a pointer to it that receives information about the stream.

seg-source.mrk: A $tagWIN32_FIND_STREAM_DATA structure or a pointer to it that receives information about the stream.

target.mrk: A $tagWIN32_FIND_STREAM_DATA structure or a pointer to it that receives information about the stream.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

trans-unit.source: This function function opens a search handle and returns information about the first stream in the specified file or directory.

seg-source.mrk: This function function opens a search handle and returns information about the first stream in the specified file or directory.

target.mrk: This function function opens a search handle and returns information about the first stream in the specified file or directory.

trans-unit.source: For files, this is always the default data stream, "::$DATA".

seg-source.mrk: For files, this is always the default data stream, "::$DATA".

target.mrk: For files, this is always the default data stream, "::$DATA".

trans-unit.source: After the search handle has been established, use it in the _WinAPI_FindNextStream() function to search for other streams in the specified file or directory.

seg-source.mrk: After the search handle has been established, use it in the _WinAPI_FindNextStream() function to search for other streams in the specified file or directory.

target.mrk: After the search handle has been established, use it in the _WinAPI_FindNextStream() function to search for other streams in the specified file or directory.

trans-unit.source: If the function fails because no streams can be found, the @extended flag will contain ERROR_HANDLE_EOF (38) system error code.

seg-source.mrk: If the function fails because no streams can be found, the @extended flag will contain ERROR_HANDLE_EOF (38) system error code.

target.mrk: If the function fails because no streams can be found, the @extended flag will contain ERROR_HANDLE_EOF (38) system error code.

trans-unit.source: When the search handle is no longer needed, it should be closed using the _WinAPI_FindClose() function.

seg-source.mrk: When the search handle is no longer needed, it should be closed using the _WinAPI_FindClose() function.

target.mrk: When the search handle is no longer needed, it should be closed using the _WinAPI_FindClose() function.

trans-unit.source: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

seg-source.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

target.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

trans-unit.source: The file must be on an NTFS file system volume.

seg-source.mrk: The file must be on an NTFS file system volume.

target.mrk: The file must be on an NTFS file system volume.

trans-unit.source: Create text file with three alternative streams named AS1, AS2, and AS3 respectively

trans-unit.source: Enumerate all existing streams in the file and read text data from each stream
